meanings.definition: Not feeling a strong desire or willingness to do something.
meanings.sent1: She seemed unmotivated to finish her homework.
meanings.sent2: He appeared unmotivated to participate in the group project.
meanings.sent3: The unmotivated cat lazily stretched out on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The plant looked unmotivated to grow in the dark corner.
meanings.sent5: The student's unmotivated attitude affected the whole class.

meanings.sent1: The team felt unmotivated after losing the game.
meanings.sent2: She showed an unmotivated response to the new challenge.
meanings.sent3: The unmotivated car refused to start on Monday mornings.
meanings.sent4: His unmotivated behavior was a hindrance to his success.
meanings.sent5: The unmotivated worker struggled to meet deadlines.
